method.summary: Query the Database for Sequence Annotations.
method.description:
This service provides full access to arbitrary database queries. Queries are accepted in a serialised XML format, executed and returned in a streaming manner. The query format is a custom subset of the capabilities of SQL; see the InterMine documentation for a full description of the query XML syntax.
This endpoint specialises in dealing with queries for sequence annotations, and returning results in [GFF3](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_feature_format) format. The user is responsible for ensuring that the query contains only suitable types for export. A suitable query is one where every view column references a field of a `SequenceFeature` (including all sub-classes). The particular field selected is not important, and the object itself will be selected.

param.default: <query name="short genes on the X chromosome" model="genomic" view="Gene.id Gene.exons.id"> <constraint path="Gene.chromosome.primaryIdentifier" op="=" value="X"/> <constraint path="Gene.length" op="<" value="1000"/> </query>
param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format
Extra columns to include as extra information in the ninth column

method.summary: Get the Contents of a List as GFF3.
method.description: This service allows users to export the contents of a list of `SequenceFeature`s as GFF3.

method.summary: Get the Contents of a List as FASTA.
method.description: This service allows users to export the contents of a list of `SequenceFeature`s or `Protein`s as [FASTA](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTA_format)

This service provides full access to arbitrary database queries. Queries are accepted in a serialised XML format, executed and returned in a streaming manner. The query format is a custom subset of the capabilities of SQL; see the InterMine documentation for a full description of the query XML syntax.
This endpoint specialises in dealing with queries for sequence, and returning results in [FASTA](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FASTA_format) format. The user is responsible for ensuring that the query contains only suitable types for export.
A suitable query is one with a single view column which references a field of a `SequenceFeature` (including all sub-classes) or of a a `Protein`. The particular field selected is not important, and the object itself will be selected.

param.default: <query name="short genes on the X chromosome" model="genomic" view="Gene.id"> <constraint path="Gene.chromosome.primaryIdentifier" op="=" value="X"/> <constraint path="Gene.length" op="<" value="1000"/> </query>
param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format
Extra columns to include as extra information in the ninth column

method.description:
This service provides full access to arbitrary database queries. Queries are accepted in a serialised XML format, executed and returned in a streaming manner. The query format is a custom subset of the capabilities of SQL; see the InterMine documentation for a full description of the query XML syntax.
This endpoint specialises in dealing with queries for genomic locations, and returning results in [UCSC BED](http://genome.ucsc.edu/FAQ/FAQformat.html) format. The user is responsible for ensuring that the query contains only suitable types for export.
A suitable query is one where every view column references a field of a `SequenceFeature` (including all sub-classes). The particular field selected is not important, and the object itself will be selected.

param.default: <query name="short genes on the X chromosome" model="genomic" view="Gene.id Gene.exons.id"> <constraint path="Gene.chromosome.primaryIdentifier" op="=" value="X"/> <constraint path="Gene.length" op="<" value="1000"/> </query>
param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format

method.summary: Create a New List from Features found in Genomic Intervals

param.description: The name of the list to save these features to
An optional description for this list
A set of tags to apply to this list
Whether or not to replace any existing list of this name

param.description: The name of the list to save these features to
An optional description for this list
A set of tags to apply to this list
Whether or not to replace any existing list of this name

body.description: A representation of the search request.
